intro: Kohleria jamesoniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Kohleria jamesoniana is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental foliage and unique floral display.
